data: It was as though she had gone to sleep the night before, and waked again upon this scene unchanged, brilliant, full of colour, a chaos of decorationâ€”confluences of noisy, garish streams of life, eddies of petty labour.

It was as though she had gone to sleep the night before, and waked again upon this scene unchanged, brilliant, full of colour, a chaos of decoration--confluences of noisy, garish streams of life, eddies of petty labour.
The Weavers: a tale of England and Egypt of fifty years ago - Volume 6
